alert.note: Alert for Mower (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 28 at 5:48PM CST until January 29 at 11:00AM CST by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...SNOW CONTINUES THIS EVENING... .Snow continues to primarily affect parts of northeast Iowa into southwest Wisconsin early this evening. Periods of higher snowfall rates will occur this evening, causing visibilities to trop below a mile at times. Impacts to travel will continue into the overnight, especially across northeast Iowa into southwest Wisconsin. Check road conditions before traveling tonight and drive with caution. A wind chill advisory has been issued for counties in southeastern Minnesota and northeast Iowa where wind chills below -20 degrees are expected into Sunday morning. With these wind chill temperatures, frostbite can occur in 30 minutes or less. ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO 11 AM CST SUNDAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IS CANCELLED... * WHAT...Very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 20 below zero. * WHERE...Mower County. * WHEN...From midnight tonight to 11 AM CST Sunday. * IMPACTS...The cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes.
info.instruction: Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves.
